Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 12:23AM Dmaxmama wrote: Sorry!  I disagree 100% .   The port in the chest is under the skin, the one in the arm leaves a tube usually about 8 inches hanging from your arm.  It gets caught every time you try to put on a bra or blouse.  There are a real pain in the butt!  Insurance companies love them, they are much cheaper.  Ask an oncology nurse you trust what they think,  Good lUCK.
Posts.Title: Port for infusions- in arm christine1000 Kodapants

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2009 10:28PM Dmaxmama wrote: There are really no reliable products to prevent the skin reaction.  If you are able to see skin marks while you have your dress on, the skin reaction will be visible.  If you have tattoes, ask the therapists to use a sharpie pen to mark the area being treated.  It might be wise to get a dress that covers the area so you aren't self-concious for the wedding photos.
Posts.Title: AUGUST 2009 RADS Alyad ChrisC433

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2009 10:04PM Dmaxmama wrote: Suggest that they mark you with paint pens.  The are available at craft stores.  The thicker tip works the best, and the blue lasts the longest.
Posts.Title: AUGUST 2009 RADS Alyad ChrisC433
